messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-DiffusionLight implementation?
The ComfyUI-DiffusionLight implementation is a simplified version of the DiffusionLight method for creating light probes in ComfyUI.
Where should the included LoRA be placed for the ComfyUI-DiffusionLight implementation to work?
The included LoRA should be placed in the ComfyUI/loras folder for the ComfyUI-DiffusionLight implementation to work properly.
Is the LoRA used in ComfyUI-DiffusionLight the same as the original diffusers one?
No, the LoRA used in ComfyUI-DiffusionLight is converted from the original diffusers one, as the original would not work in ComfyUI as it is.
Where can the example workflow for ComfyUI-DiffusionLight be found?
The example workflow for ComfyUI-DiffusionLight can be found in the examples folder of the implementation.
Are there any example images demonstrating the results of using ComfyUI-DiffusionLight?
Yes, there are example images showing the results of using ComfyUI-DiffusionLight, which can be found in the implementation's repository.
Is the ComfyUI-DiffusionLight implementation a complete replication of the original DiffusionLight method?
No, the ComfyUI-DiffusionLight implementation is a simplified version of the original DiffusionLight method.
What is the main function of the DiffusionLight method?
The main function of the DiffusionLight method is to create light probes.
